result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: SPD Appointment - Attorney Francis Rivard
Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, Moved Left No Address, Unable to Forward

10:25 AM cases 20CT14, 21CM337, 21CM498, 22CF409, 22CF923, 22CM22 called. Prosecuting Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mark H. Schlosser in court without counsel. Public Defender office is still working to find new representation for the defendant. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/31/2022 at 2:30 PM
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on November 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.
It is ordered Attorney Melissa Petersen is withdrawn as counsel.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Proposed Order re: Motion to Withdraw
Motion to Withdraw as Counsel by Attorney Melissa Petersen

9:40 AM cases 22CM22, 22CF923, 21CM498, 22CF409, 21CM337, 20CT14 called. Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mark H. Schlosser in court with Attorney Melissa M. Petersen.

22CF923: Court orders warrant quashed and bond is set. Defense waives reading of Complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 

Court informs the Defendant that he will need to apply to Public Defender's office to have Attorney Petersen appointed to 22CF923.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 09/26/2022 at 1:30 PM
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on October 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:31 AM cases 20CT14, 21CM337, 21CM498, 22CF409, 22CM22 called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark H. Schlosser in court.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Mark H. Schlosser. There is no offer at this time from the State.
Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Hearing - Moved Left No Address, Unable to Forward, Return to Sender
Hearing on July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Cases called at 9:59 AM: 20CT14, 21CM337, 21CM498, 22CF409, 22CM22.
Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark H. Schlosser in court with Attorney Melissa M. Petersen.
Attorney Petersen requests a new PTC and RTN. 
Court notes the oldest case is from 12/2019 and there will be no adjournments after today. If there is no agreement at the next hearings the matters will be set for trial.
22CF409: Defendant waives reading of Complaint. Time Limits for Preliminary Hearing waived. $2,000 Signature Bond Set.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on: 6/8/22 at 3:00 PM.
RTN: 7/11/22 at 9:30 AM.

9:51 AM cases 21CM337, 21CM498, 22CM22, 20CT14 and 22CF409 called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark H. Schlosser not in court.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Mark H. Schlosser. Defense has spoke to defendant recently. 
State asks for a warrant based on non appearance and number of files.
Hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on May 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Bachman requests an adjournment.

Cases called at 9:39 AM: 20CT14, 21CM337, 21CM498, 22CM22.
Prosecuting Attorney Andrew James Gunderson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Mark H. Schlosser appeared by phone, Attorney John Charles Bachman appeared in court for Mark H. Schlosser. 
Attorney Bachman requests an adjournment.
Hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on February 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Cases called at 11:03 AM - 20CT14, 21CM337, 21CM498, 22CM22)
Defendant Mark Schlosser appears with Attorney John Bachman.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense indicates there is an agreement in the files.  Defendant must first be fingerprinted in 22CM22 before the court with take a plea.  
(Cases re-called at 11:12 AM)
Defense outlines agreement for the Court.  Court is unsure about restitution for an un-charged case and how to assess that.  Court is also not comfortable taking a plea that involves victim(s) during 11:00 AM intake.  Attorney Bachman to speak to ADA assigned to the case - Attorney Afton Lewis.
(Cases re-called at 11:33 AM)
Defense waives reading of Complaint in 22CM22.  Defendant released on his own recognizance in that case as well.  All cases to go into intake to resolve.  
Return Hearing: 2/16/2022 at 9:30 AM
Initial appearance on January 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Rindal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 22CM22 has an order in date of 01/20/22 at 11am. All cases are rescheduled to go in on that date and time.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
